view

Class ViewController

  • Object
    • ViewController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Initializable

    public class ViewController
extends Object
implements Initializable
    Handles communication between the JavaFX FXML file and MV-CoDA's main controller, and reports information and errors to the user The ViewController talks to the main controller via a listener interface to decouple the two. This class contains a number of JAVAFX bindings and listeners to enable communication between diferent parts of the GUI, and the model via the main controller
    Author:
    tony

      void initFontSizeBox()
      We set a specific number of fontsizes which can be used (these must be sensible to fit in straps, chart, number boxes in a television resolution) and allow the user to set these.

      Main constructor for the GUI - binds buttons and views to the model with bindings, bidirectional bindings and listeners

      • loadThumb

        private void loadThumb(PlaylistEntry entry)
        Loads the thumbnail display in a worker thread, and delays main thread so listeners can get through
        Parameters:
        entry - playlist entry we want to find a thumbnail for

      • createWorker

        public Task<?> createWorker(PlaylistEntry entry)
        Worker thread that gets thumbnails for the GUI, for now by using Xuggler's Media Tools API in Thumbnail Grabber imp in the util package
        Parameters:
        entry -
        Returns:

      • initThemeSelectBox

        public void initThemeSelectBox()
        Initialises the combobox that holds themes - these are held directly as Themes in the box and their toString() methods provide the text in the box

      • initFontSelectBox

        public void initFontSelectBox()
        By obtaining the fonts on the local machine, we populate the font select box with their string representations, and because we are using strings We are able to set a font in the model. A listener ensures that changes in the value are provided to the main controller

      • initFontSizeBox

        public void initFontSizeBox()
        We set a specific number of fontsizes which can be used (these must be sensible to fit in straps, chart, number boxes in a television resolution) and allow the user to set these. A listener ensures that changes in the value are provided to the main controller

      • sendPlaylistNodesToScreen

        public void sendPlaylistNodesToScreen(Playlist playlist)
        Takes a playlist and sends the entries to the GUI's list view
        Parameters:
        playlist - a playlist

      • loadPlaylist

        void loadPlaylist(ActionEvent e)
        Allows the user to request that a playlist file is deserialised and returned to the GUI. Will clear any existing entries if the user doesn't cancel Will report errors with that process directly to the user
        Parameters:
        e - when button accessed by user

      • savePlaylist

        void savePlaylist(ActionEvent e)
        Allows the user to request that a playlist file is serialised containing data currently in the GUI. Will report errors with that process directly to the user
        Parameters:
        e - when button is accessed by user

      • clearPlaylist

        void clearPlaylist(ActionEvent e)
        Allows the user to clear a playlist and start afresh. Will check the values of buttons and return fonts to default sizes
        Parameters:
        e - when button is accessed by user

      • addPlaylistEntry

        void addPlaylistEntry(ActionEvent e)
                throws IOException
        Allows the user to request that an individual music video from secondary storage is added to their current playlist. Will be added at the bottom of the playlist. Will report errors with that process directly to the user
        Parameters:
        e - when button is accessed by user
        Throws:
        IOException

      • checkMoveButtons

        private void checkMoveButtons()
        We must only enable these buttons if there is more than ONE playlist entry

      • render

        void render(ActionEvent e)
        Allows the user to request the current GUI's playlist to render to a video file. Reports errors in that proces back to the user
        Parameters:
        e - when button is accessed by user

      • popup

        public static void popup(String text)
        JAVAFX has no default dialog boxes. We call a simple implementation of a dialog box when the user needs to be informed from the model
        Parameters:
        text - the text to display

      • getFileChooser

        public static FileChooser getFileChooser(String filetype)
        Generic method for the load/save actions the user can request. JAVAFX brings up a standard windows file dialog, which handles a lot of problems for us. Ensures that the file extension the user requests is provided to the dialog
        Parameters:
        filetype -
        Returns:

      • reFindPlaylistEntry

        public static void reFindPlaylistEntry(int pos)
        When the user double clicks on a problem entry in the playlist, we allow them to select a file from secondary storage
        Parameters:
        pos - the position in the playlist array the entry concerned is located
